issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Cannot update the loadbalancing.loadbalancer_emi property using euca-modify-property. Current setting is NULL and when running euca-modify-property -p loadbalancing.loadbalancer_emi=emi-{ID} property never changes.

comments.body:
The build is the x86_64 nightly repository for centos 6 and was upgraded from the 3.2 repository. http://downloads.eucalyptus.com/software/eucalyptus/nightly/3.3/centos/

Let me know if there is a way to find out any more information that you need. Thanks!

It may help if you can run "rpm -qa | grep eucalyptus" so we can see which packages you have.

If you have upgraded to 3.3.0 and then moved to more recent development packages you will certainly see issues, as upgrading between pre-release versions is not supported (upgrade to 3.3 is currently being tested)

Here is the information you have requested:

{code}
# rpm -qa | grep eucalyptus
eucalyptus-admin-tools-3.3.0-0.0.1003.20130523git4c2cafd0.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-walrus-3.3.0-0.0.1003.20130523git4c2cafd0.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-3.3.0-0.0.1003.20130523git4c2cafd0.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-common-java-libs-3.3.0-0.0.1003.20130523git4c2cafd0.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cc-3.3.0-0.0.1003.20130523git4c2cafd0.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-console-3.3.0-0.0.1003.20130523git4c2cafd0.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-load-balancer-image-1.0.0-0.74.130522git6023051.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-gl-3.3.0-0.0.1003.20130523git4c2cafd0.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-sc-3.3.0-0.0.1003.20130523git4c2cafd0.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-release-3.3-0.1.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-common-java-3.3.0-0.0.1003.20130523git4c2cafd0.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cloud-3.3.0-0.0.1003.20130523git4c2cafd0.el6.x86_64
{code}

{code}
# psql -h /var/lib/eucalyptus/db/data/ -p 8777 eucalyptus_config -c "select * from config_static_property where config_static_prop_name = 'loadbalancing.loadbalancer_emi';"
                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid     
     | version |                               config_static_field_name                                |    config_stati
c_prop_name     | config_static_field_value 
----------------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+---------------------------------
-----+---------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------
----------------+---------------------------
 00dbbe163d65664f013d6566b5f0009b | 2013-03-13 16:17:42.896 | 2013-03-13 16:17:42.896 | d57b9a0c-3454-4552-92bf-6aec0c54
ea54 |       0 | com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.activities.LoadbalancerInstanceLauncher.loadbalancer_emi | loadbalancing.l
oadbalancer_emi | NULL
(1 row)
{code}
{code}
# euca-describe-services 
SERVICE eucalyptus      eucalyptus      {my_ip}   ENABLED         25      http://{my_ip}:8773/services/Eucalyptus   arn:euca:eucalyptus:::{my_ip}/
SERVICE jetty           eucalyptus      {my_ip}   ENABLED         25      http://{my_ip}:8773/services/Jetty        arn:euca:eucalyptus::jetty:{my_ip}/
SERVICE tokens          eucalyptus      {my_ip}   ENABLED         25      http://{my_ip}:8773/services/Tokens       arn:euca:eucalyptus::tokens:{my_ip}/
SERVICE bootstrap       bootstrap       {my_ip}   ENABLED         25      http://{my_ip}:8773/services/Empyrean     arn:euca:bootstrap:::{my_ip}/
SERVICE euare           eucalyptus      {my_ip}   ENABLED         25      http://{my_ip}:8773/services/Euare        arn:euca:eucalyptus::euare:{my_ip}/
SERVICE cloudwatch      eucalyptus      {my_ip}   ENABLED         25      http://{my_ip}:8773/services/CloudWatch   arn:euca:eucalyptus::cloudwatch:{my_ip}/
SERVICE storage         CLUSTER01       sc_01           ENABLED         25      http://{my_ip}:8773/services/Storage      arn:euca:eucalyptus:CLUSTER01:storage:sc_01/
SERVICE dns             eucalyptus      {my_ip}   ENABLED         25      http://{my_ip}:8773/services/Dns          arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:{my_ip}/
SERVICE autoscaling     eucalyptus      {my_ip}   ENABLED         25      http://{my_ip}:8773/services/AutoScaling  arn:euca:eucalyptus::autoscaling:{my_ip}/
SERVICE notifications   eucalyptus      {my_ip}   ENABLED         25      http://{my_ip}:8773/services/Notifications    arn:euca:eucalyptus::notifications:{my_ip}/
SERVICE cluster         CLUSTER01       cc_01           NOTREADY        25      http://{my_ip}:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCarn:euca:eucalyptus:CLUSTER01:cluster:cc_01/
SERVICE loadbalancing   eucalyptus      {my_ip}   NOTREADY        25      http://{my_ip}:8773/services/LoadBalancing    arn:euca:eucalyptus::loadbalancing:{my_ip}/
SERVICE walrus          walrus          walrus          ENABLED         25      http://{my_ip}:8773/services/Walrus       arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:walrus/
SERVICE reporting       bootstrap       {my_ip}   ENABLED         25      http://{my_ip}:8773/services/Reporting    arn:euca:bootstrap::reporting:{my_ip}/

I used this information to download the load balancer and set it up as an emi. https://github.com/eucalyptus/load-balancer-image/blob/master/README.md
The database does not seem to match the current code, is it possible that an earlier version of 3.3.0 was installed?
I've been following the upgrade trail through 3.3.0 m1 to m6. Would the database not be upgraded through that process?

Upgrading between development versions is not supported (let us know if you see docs that suggest otherwise)

You could fix this issue by removing that row from the database, but it is likely you will encounter other issues related to an incorrect database schema or content.

The recommended approach would be to remove the database and re-configure.
Are there documented steps for removing the database and re-configure? Does this mean that my users and images will have to all be re-created? Thanks!

You can upgrade from 3.2.2 to 3.3.0 so you might want to check if you still have the backup (I think these are under /var/lib/eucalyptus/backups/)

The best places to go for further assistance with this are engage (https://engage.eucalyptus.com/) or the #eucalyptus IRC channel on freenode (http://webchat.freenode.net/ or your favourite IRC client)

Adding a link to the documentation for handling an upgrade failure/downgrading. This is for 3.2, but there would be similar docs for other versions.

http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/3.2/ig/upgrade_failure.html#upgrade_failure
